723088f-a.text:
Rutgers Street, west aide, north from, but not including Cherry Street.
June 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

718723f-b.text:
Cherry Street, no th side, west from (No. 244), but nd. including Rutgers Street, to the Manhattan Bridge (west of Pike Street). The stables in the foreground, are Nos. 242-238, and are between Rutgers
and Pelham Streets.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
A view further westward, and showing across the empty lot at the N.E. corner of Pelham Street. the buildings on the west side of the
same, at and adjoining the N.W. corner.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
The same as No. 2, but in the opposite direction, and showing prominently the enpty let at the N.E. corner of Pike Street. The building shown being demolished is No. 222. Cherry Street.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

718729f-b.text:
(1)
Cherry Street, west from (No. 244) but not including Rutgers Shieet, showing an anchorage of the Manhattan Bridge, as it straddles the street slightly west of Pike Slip. Shown on the south side of the street (left)
is a lumber yard and scrap-iron dump.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing an exclusive view of the south side of the street,
and including a portion of the Manhattan Bridge.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

718730f-a.text:
246 to 260 Cherry Street, north side, at Rutgers Street, as seen, north on Rutgers Slip (foreground) from Water Street. No. 250 and 248-246 appear in View No. 1, at and adjoining the N.W. corner while Nos. 256 to 260 appear in No. 2, at, adjoining and east of the N.N. corner. Also shown (a continuation of the Slip, when north of Cherry Street) is Rutgers Street of which Nos. 66 to 52 appear on the west side, north from Cherry to Monroe Streets. The small plavground area shown in the foreground is in the center of the Slip and extends the length of the Slip (2 blocks) between South and Cherry Streets. This set of two views was taken en
the same date.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

718727f-a.text:
Cherry Street, east from and including Rutgers Street. This view shows mainly the north side. The building lettered with signe, is No. 6l
Rutgers Slip and is at the N.E. corner.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

718728f-a.text:
Cherry Street, west from and across Rutgers Slip, showing mainly, buildings on the north side of this thorofare this side of the Manhattan Bridge (causeway seen). To the left is the small park that is in the center the Slip and extends from Cherry to South Streets.
View 1: June 6, 1930
View 2: April 23, 1939
L. Sperr

723076f-a.title: Manhattan: Rutgers Slip - Cherry Street
723076f-a.text:
Rutgers Slip, east side, south from Cherry, to and including Water Streets. Also shown is Cherry Strcet, south side, east from and inclhding
Putgers Slip.
June 17, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
